{"step_by_step_thinking": "Toluidine blue is a basic thiazine metachromatic dye with high affinity for acidic tissue components, thereby staining tissues rich in DNA and RNA. It is used in a test to identify dysplasia and carcinoma in the oral cavity. Therefore, it is used to differentiate between normal and malignant cells, not to differentiate between specific diseases.", "answer_choice": "A"}
